summary:
"The Scream" is a famous painting by Norwegian artist Edvard Munch, created in 1893. The picture shows a person with a scared face, and it's known as one of the most recognizable art pieces worldwide. Munch got the idea while walking at sunset, seeing the sky turn red, which he described as nature's scream.

Scholars believe this could be due to a volcanic eruption or Munch's sister's mental health struggles. "The Scream" influenced the Expressionist art movement and was so valuable that one version sold for a huge amount of money in 2012.
title: The Scream
